title: Magnus Carlsen defends Blitz title, shares it with Nepomniachtchi; Wenjun Champion in Women’s section - Sportstar
summary:
Magnus Carlsen defends Blitz title, beats Nepomniachtchi in final; Wenjun Champion in Women’s section

Publication Date: January 1, 2025
Source: The Hindu

In a historic and unprecedented result, reigning World Blitz Champion Magnus Carlsen of Norway shared the 2024 World Blitz Championship title with Russia’s Ian Nepomniachtchi on Wall Street, New York, on Wednesday.

  • Carlsen started the final with back-to-back wins but both players ended up in sudden-death games.
  • After three consecutive draws in sudden death, Carlsen offered to share the title.
  • This is Carlsen's eighth Blitz title and 18th major championship triumph overall.
  • In the Women’s section, China’s Ju Wenjun triumphed over Lei Tingjie to become the Women’s World Blitz champion.
— International Chess Federation (@FIDE_chess) January 1, 2025

The final features rematches from previous championships and highlights the competitive spirit of both champions.
newTitle: Magnus Carlsen Share Blitz Title with Ian Nepomniachtchi; Ju Wenjun Wins Women's Section

title: 'Ashwin's mid-series retirement selfish. He won't make it public but it was a spiteful reaction…': Daryll Cullinan to HT - Hindustan Times
summary:
'Ashwin's mid-series retirement selfish. He won't make it public but it was a spiteful reaction…': Daryll Cullinan to HT

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Hindustan Times

The Border-Gavaskar Trophy is nearing its end with Australia leading 2-1 against India. As the teams prepare for the Sydney Test, former South African cricketer Daryll Cullinan criticizes Ravichandran Ashwin's decision to retire mid-series, calling it selfish and disruptive.

  • India's senior players, including Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli, are underperforming.
  • Cullinan suggests Rohit Sharma should transition to white-ball cricket due to his struggles with pace bowling.
  • Virat Kohli's technical flaws are outlined as contributing to his lack of form.
  • Cullinan shares concerns about Rishabh Pant's approach to batting in critical situations.
  • He expresses doubts about fast bowlers being made Test captains, hinting at Jasprit Bumrah's potential leadership.
  • Cullinan believes that India has the potential to win the Sydney Test but criticizes Ashwin's mid-series retirement as a detrimental decision.
“Ashwin should not be retiring or allowed to retire mid-series. It was a selfish move, clearly for reasons he won't make public.” - Daryll Cullinan

Cullinan concludes that the South African team qualifying for the World Test Championship final is a significant achievement, but questions the seriousness of the Championship's format.
newTitle: Daryll Cullinan Critiques Ashwin's Mid-Series Retirement

title: Jasprit Bumrah Breaks R Ashwin's All-Time Rating Points Record In ICC Rankings - News18
summary:
Jasprit Bumrah Breaks R Ashwin's All-Time Rating Points Record In ICC Rankings

Last Updated: January 01, 2025, 20:15 IST, Source: News18

Fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah continues to reach new heights. On Wednesday, Bumrah surpassed India legend Ravichandran Ashwin’s all-time rating-point record in ICC rankings. Ashwin held the record for eight years when he reached rating of 904 in December 2016 which was the highest ever for an Indian bowler. In the latest rankings, Bumrah has 907 rankings points which is a new record for an Indian.

It is also the joint-17th highest in the all-time list with Derek Underwood of England.

  • Bumrah's achievement of 907 rating points surpasses Ashwin's previous record of 904.
  • This marks Bumrah as the world's top-ranked Test bowler.
  • He took 9 wickets in the latest match in Melbourne, bringing his series total to 30 over four matches.
“Despite India suffering a big defeat at the hands of Australia, Bumrah's performance has been stellar.”

The achievement is significant as it reflects Bumrah's dominance and sets a new benchmark for Indian bowlers.
newTitle: Jasprit Bumrah Breaks R Ashwin's All-Time Rating Points Record In ICC Rankings
